explanation:
The report is correct. In OS_SymbolLookup_Static the test

    if (strcmp(StaticSym->Name, SymbolName) == 0 &&
        (ModuleName == NULL || strcmp(StaticSym->Module, ModuleName) == 0))

can call strcmp with a NULL pointer. If ModuleName is non-NULL and StaticSym->Module == NULL the right-hand operand of the || is evaluated and strcmp(NULL, ModuleName) is invoked (undefined behavior). Although the caller OS_ModuleSymbolLookup checks SymbolName and StaticSym->Name is checked at the top of the loop, OS_SymbolLookup_Static itself does not guard StaticSym->Module (nor SymbolName in general), so the function can pass a NULL pointer to strcmp and thus violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. Suggested fixes are to verify StaticSym->Module is non-NULL before calling strcmp (or reorder/guard the comparisons).
